result.execSummary:
The defendant Matthew A Reynolds was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Controlled Substance, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Pay all court costs and supervision fees. DNA surcharge waived.  If supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.
Obtain GED or HSED.  Obtain and maintain full-time employment OR attend school full-time, may be a combination of both to equal 40 hours per week.
Alcohol assessment and follow through with recommendations. No alcohol, random UA's at discretion of agent.
Drug assessment and follow through with recommendations. No controlled substances, random UA's at discretion of agent.  Defendant may only take medication pursuant to a prescription.

Counseling, treatment, services as deemed appropriate by agent, including an AODA assessment, and cognitive intervention. Pay restitution if requested. Defendant must obey all rules and regulations of probation.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Matthew A Reynolds

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Per RASO - mandatory jail time has been served
DOC-Notice of Case Status change - revoked - sentenced to co. jail.
Status conference on May 5, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Matthew A Reynolds in court with attorney Erin Joy Larsen.  Christopher D. Steenrod appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Elizabeth Kiel.
Parties are requesting an adjournment.
BTC: Adjournment granted.  Status conference scheduled for May 5, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Status conference on March 27, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions:  No contact with the victim, TB (person, property, residence or family).   It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any controlled substances.  This is to be monitored by random UA's and/or breathalyzers.  The defendant is to report directly to Zimmerman Consulting Inc. (ZCI) for monitoring - report to 524 Main Street, Suite 302, Racine, WI  53403 (third floor of the Monument Square Building) or call (262)632-1780 to immediately schedule an appointment.   The defendant is further ordered to report for testing after each court appearance.   You have been ordered to have your fingerprints/photographs taken as a condition of your bond.  Report to the Sheriff's Department Records Bureau. Hours:  Tuesdays, Wednesdays and Thursday between 9:00 a.m. and 11:00 a.m. or between 1:00 p.m. and 3:00 p.m.  Make all court appearances on time.  Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.

Defendant Matthew A Reynolds in court.  Robin K. Green appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter Mark Garvin.  Reading of complaint is waived, probable cause found, p-ng, bond set.  Status conference scheduled for March 27, 2015 at 08:30 am.
